private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels: A E I O
I can move only the top block of any stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to reconfiguring the stacks so that A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on O, and O on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants: B C D F G H J K L M N P Q R S T V W X Y Z (only those present apply)
I can move only the top block of any stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to reconfiguring the stacks so that A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on O, and O on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the target stack ordering.

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labeled blocks: D F L O G N B M K A J E I H C
Agents can move only top blocks of stacks and can move only one block at a time
One agent is restricted to vowel-labeled blocks and the other to consonant-labeled blocks
Initial configuration: D is on the table

report.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. You are specialized in manipulating vowel-labeled blocks (A E I O). Do not produce PDDL. Provide a concise structured report that lists which vowel blocks you can move given the public initial configuration, any top-of-stack constraints you observe, potential intermediate placements you can perform, and any assumptions or missing information needed to construct a full planner input. Keep the report factual and self-contained.
report.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Consider the public information and initial configuration provided by the environment. Describe which vowel blocks you can currently move, the constraints that apply to your actions, possible safe moves you can perform toward the global goal, and any questions or missing pieces of information you need for planning.

report.system_prompt: You are consonant_agent. You are specialized in manipulating consonant-labeled blocks (all non-vowels present). Do not produce PDDL. Provide a concise structured report that lists which consonant blocks you can move given the public initial configuration, any top-of-stack constraints you observe, potential intermediate placements you can perform, and any assumptions or missing information needed to construct a full planner input. Keep the report factual and self-contained.
report.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Consider the public information and initial configuration provided by the environment. Describe which consonant blocks you can currently move, the constraints that apply to your actions, possible safe moves you can perform toward the global goal, and any questions or missing pieces of information you need for planning.

pddl.system_prompt: You are orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the agents' reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that models the block manipulation task for the FastDownwards solver. You must keep the agents' actions distinct in the model, reflect the vowel/consonant movement restrictions, and model that only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block at a time. Provide the PDDL domain enclosed between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem enclosed between <problem></problem> tags. Specify in the domain any agent-specific action schemas if needed and ensure compatibility with FastDownwards conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the structured reports from the vowel and consonant agents. Use those reports and the public environment information to produce a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem pair that achieves the target stack ordering. Ensure the PDDL is complete and unambiguous for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Preserve distinct action names or predicates if modeling agent-specific capabilities.
